page.title: 07Education A Day at School
page.content: {Anna.}At 9 o'clock,when I come in I get my hymn book and line up to go into assembly.Assembly is usually made up with a Bible story,a prayer,the Lord's prayer and a hymn,usually on the subject of the story.When we come back into class we finish off old work while Mr. Bagley calls the register. Then we do multiplication tables.If we have practised our tables until they are perfect we go on to special books called 6 a day,7 a day etc etc.Then,on Wednesday's,we do either work from Oxford English books,with the numbers to our standards.Or we write stories in our English books.At 10:25 we go out for playtime and at 10:45 we get on the bus to go swimming,(on Wednesday's.) It costs 45p to go swim- ming. The pool is in Alnwick.There is a man called Alan who teaches the swi- mmers,(people further on.)Mr.Bagley
